title: Support Contact Details & Opening Hours
text: Hours published to customers (and referred to by the SLA) are on our website: Support - K3 (k3btg.com) The opening ours for the support are available under What times are Support available? PSV Eindhoven matchdays: Support starts 2 hours before the match and ends 4 hours after the start of the match MStore customers all have weekends and Public Holidays, but NOT weekday evenings

The opening ours for the support are available under What times are Support available?

title: Other Useful Contact Details
text: Other Useful Contact Details 27 May 2022 16:02 Useful Email Addresses SameSystem Samesystem is a company that does shift-planning and budgets etc, almost all of our customers uses this and we provide API keys to them for the integrations support@samesystem.com Sales accountmanagement.europe@k3btg.dk Service Delivery distribution lists Service-Delivery-ALL – will be used to notify everyone in our delivery organisation. This will be information that is pertinent or of interest to all. Will be used for corporate or strategic messaging. Service-Delivery-EFW – will be used for our Extended Family Workforce, so any contractors either directly or via our alliance resource partners such as Hexaware, SMART et al Service-Delivery-ELT – will be used to reach our extended leadership team in Service Delivery – if you need to reach or ask a manager, please use this distro Service-Delivery-Escalations – will be used to escalate any issues of concern relating to customer delivery to our escalations team Service-Delivery-Project-Managers – will be used to reach our project management team for any questions regarding project statuses or any other queries Service-Delivery-Solutions-Delivery – will be used to reach our colleagues working on SaaS delivery, Imagine, Professional Services Service-Delivery-Staff – will be used exclusively for colleagues employed directly by K3 primarily for disseminating information regarding our employee HR suite of services
description:
Other Useful Contact Details

27 May 2022

16:02

 

Useful Email Addresses

  • SameSystem Samesystem is a company that does shift-planning and budgets etc, almost all of our customers uses this and we provide API keys to them for the integrations

support@samesystem.com

 

  • Sales

accountmanagement.europe@k3btg.dk

 

  • Service Delivery distribution lists
    • Service-Delivery-ALL – will be used to notify everyone in our delivery organisation.  This will be information that is pertinent or of interest to all.  Will be used for corporate or strategic messaging.
    • Service-Delivery-EFW – will be used for our Extended Family Workforce, so any contractors either directly or via our alliance resource partners such as Hexaware, SMART et al
    • Service-Delivery-ELT – will be used to reach our extended leadership team in Service Delivery – if you need to reach or ask a manager, please use this distro
    • Service-Delivery-Escalations – will be used to escalate any issues of concern relating to customer delivery to our escalations team
    • Service-Delivery-Project-Managers – will be used to reach our project management team for any questions regarding project statuses or any other queries
    • Service-Delivery-Solutions-Delivery – will be used to reach our colleagues working on SaaS delivery, Imagine, Professional Services
    • Service-Delivery-Staff – will be used exclusively for colleagues employed directly by K3 primarily for disseminating information regarding our employee HR suite of services

title: INTERNAL guide to the Service Level Agreement (SLA)
text: The Global Standard SLA can be found on K3's SharePoint at Global Standard SLA.pdf . Customers can access it via being logged onto the portal at Service Level Agreement (SLA) Customers can also access it via this link which is "hidden" i.e. it's not Google searchable but it does not require authentication - https://www.k3btg.com/docs/global_standard_sla.pdf . The SLA applies via the reference in the General Terms which customers have noted on their subscriptions agreements which refer to https://www.k3btg.com/product-and-service-terms/ which in turn refers to the above "hidden" link.
description:

The SLA applies via the reference in the General Terms which customers have noted on their subscriptions agreements which refer to https://www.k3btg.com/product-and-service-terms/ which in turn refers to the above "hidden" link.

title: Internal Glossary & Acronyms
text: General internal Glossary & Acronyms TABLE OF CONTENTS General Business / Product Terms Customer Names General Business / Product Terms Acronym / Phrase Meaning AD Active Directory API Application Programming Interface BER Beyond Economic Repair BO Back Office CDS Catalogue Delivery Service CnP Chip and Pin COE Customers Own Equipment CRM Customer Relationship Management CSM Customer Success Manager (like an account manager) CSR Corporate Social Responsibility DD Direct Debit DdD Detail Data Denmark DM Duty Manager DMZ Demilitarised Zone (Networking/Routers) EDI Electronic Data Interchange. Also see ESG below. ESG Environmental, Social, and Governance. (also see CSR above) Refers to set of standards measuring a business's impact on society, the environment, and how transparent and accountable it is. Commonly used when discussing Viji and sustainability. FOC Free Of Charge FTP File Transfer Protocol KB Knowledge Base MGF Managed Goods Flow MOI MStore Online Interface (i.e. the API) OKR Objectives and Key Results OPOS Operating Procedures Outline Sheet (drivers for POS devices) ORB Order Ready Board (Imagine - seen by customers) OSD Order Status Display (Imagine - used by kitchen) OU Organisational Unit PED PIN Entry Device (i..e a standalone card payment terminal) PLU Price Lookup (MStore term) POP Popup Order and Pay (Imagine feature) . Can also mean Pickup Order & Pay. Similar to TOP except can pre-order for collection/delivery POS Point of Sale PWA Progressive Web App RDP Remote Desktop RIAB Retail In A Box RMA Return Merchandise Authorisation RMS Retail Management System (Microsoft Dynamics) RTB Return to Base SCO Self Check Out SFTP Secure File Transfer Protocol SKU Stock Keeping Unit SLA Service Level Agreement TOP Table Order and Pay (Imagine feature) VM Virtual Machine X-Read or X-Report X reports are an anytime snapshot of sales totals and till activities Z-Read or Z-Report Z report is the end-of-day report run when you are closing the trading day Customer Names Acronym Customer Name EH English Heritage HE Historic England
description:
General internal Glossary & Acronyms


TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • General Business / Product Terms
  • Customer Names

General Business / Product Terms

Acronym / Phrase 

Meaning 

AD

Active Directory

API 

Application Programming Interface 

BER

Beyond Economic Repair

BO 

Back Office 

CDS

Catalogue Delivery Service

CnP

Chip and Pin

COE

Customers Own Equipment

CRM 

Customer Relationship Management 

CSM

Customer Success Manager (like an account manager)

CSR 

Corporate Social Responsibility 

DD

Direct Debit

DdD 

Detail Data Denmark 

DM

Duty Manager

DMZ

Demilitarised Zone (Networking/Routers)

EDI 

Electronic Data Interchange. Also see ESG below. 

ESG

Environmental, Social, and Governance. (also see CSR above)

Refers to  set of standards measuring a business's impact on society, the environment, and how transparent and accountable it is. Commonly used when discussing Viji and sustainability.

FOC

Free Of Charge

FTP 

File Transfer Protocol 

KB 

Knowledge Base 

MGF  

Managed Goods Flow 

MOIMStore Online Interface (i.e. the API)

OKR 

Objectives and Key Results 

OPOS

Operating Procedures Outline Sheet  (drivers for POS devices)

ORB

Order Ready Board (Imagine - seen by customers)

OSD

Order Status Display (Imagine - used by kitchen)

OU

Organisational Unit

PED 

PIN Entry Device (i..e a standalone card payment terminal) 

PLU 

Price Lookup (MStore term) 

POP 

Popup Order and Pay (Imagine feature) . Can also mean Pickup Order & Pay. Similar to TOP except can pre-order for collection/delivery

POS  

Point of Sale 

PWA

Progressive Web App

RDP

Remote Desktop

RIAB

Retail In A Box

RMA

Return Merchandise Authorisation

RMS

Retail Management System (Microsoft Dynamics)

RTB

Return to Base

SCO 

Self Check Out 

SFTP

Secure File Transfer Protocol

SKU 

Stock Keeping Unit 

SLA 

Service Level Agreement 

TOP 

Table Order and Pay (Imagine feature) 

VM

Virtual Machine

X-Read or X-Report

X reports are an anytime snapshot of sales totals and till activities

Z-Read or Z-Report

Z report is the end-of-day report run when you are closing the trading day


Customer Names

Acronym 

Customer Name

EH 

English Heritage 

HE 

Historic England

title: Program Steps Recorder (PSR)
text: Program Steps Recorder (PSR) 04 May 2023 10:05 Program Steps Recorder (PSR) is a built in tool to most versions of Windows and can be used to record the steps and button presses so that the steps a user makes can be followed. To launch the program go to start and run and type PSR or press Windows Key and Q and type PSR To start the recording click start recording Once all the relevant steps have been taken, press stop record and it it will display what is has recorded. Etc. You know have the option to either re-record the steps or save On clicking save, it will prompt where to save the files to, the file will be a .zip which can then either be emailed to a support address or copied via file transfer. The contents of the zip is a *.mht file is based on a webpage A file with the . MHT file extension is an MHTML Web Archive file that can hold HTML files, images, animation, audio, and other media content. Unlike HTML files, these aren't restricted to holding just text content An Example of a file. Recorded Steps This file contains all the steps and information that was recorded to help you describe the recorded steps to others. Before sharing this file, you should verify the following: The steps below accurately describe the recording. There is no information below or on any screenshots that you do not want others to see. Passwords or any other text you typed were not recorded, except for function and shortcut keys that you used. You can do the following: Review the recorded steps Review the recorded steps as a slide show Review the additional details Steps Next Step 1: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:41) User right click on "Desktop (list)" in "Program Manager" Step 1 screenshot. Previous Next Step 2: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:42) User left click on "New (menu item)" Step 2 screenshot. Previous Next Step 3: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:44) User left click on "Text Document (menu item)" Step 3 screenshot. Previous Next Step 4: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:46) User keyboard input on "Desktop (list)" in "Program Manager" [... ENTER] Step 4 screenshot. Previous Next Step 5: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:49) User left double click on "This is a test.txt (list item)" in "Program Manager" Step 5 screenshot. Previous Next Step 6: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:50) User keyboard input on "Text Editor (edit)" in "This is a test.txt - Notepad" [...] Step 6 screenshot. Previous Next Step 7: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:52) User left click on "Close (button)" in "*This is a test.txt - Notepad" Step 7 screenshot. Previous Step 8: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:53) User left click on "Save (button)" in "Notepad" Step 8 screenshot. Return to top of page... Additional Details The following section contains the additional details that were recorded. These details help accurately identify the programs and UI you used in this recording. This section may contain text that is internal to programs that only very advanced users or programmers may understand. Please review these details to ensure that they do not contain any information that you would not like others to see. Recording Session: ‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:39 - 10:38:59 Recorded Steps: 8, Missed Steps: 0, Other Errors: 0 Operating System: 19041.1.amd64fre.vb_release.191206-1406 10.0.0.0.2.48 Step 1: User right click on "Desktop (list)" in "Program Manager" Program: Windows Explorer, 10.0.19041.2845 (WinBuild.160101.0800), Microsoft Corporation, EXPLORER.EXE, EXPLORER.EXE UI Elements: Desktop, SysListView32, SHELLDLL_DefView, Program Manager, Progman Step 2: User left click on "New (menu item)" Program: Windows Explorer, 10.0.19041.2845 (WinBuild.160101.0800), Microsoft Corporation, EXPLORER.EXE, EXPLORER.EXE UI Elements: New, Context, #32768 Step 3: User left click on "Text Document (menu item)" Program: Windows Explorer, 10.0.19041.2845 (WinBuild.160101.0800), Microsoft Corporation, EXPLORER.EXE, EXPLORER.EXE UI Elements: Text Document, New, #32768, Program Manager, Progman Step 4: User keyboard input on "Desktop (list)" in "Program Manager" [... ENTER] Program: Windows Explorer, 10.0.19041.2845 (WinBuild.160101.0800), Microsoft Corporation, EXPLORER.EXE, EXPLORER.EXE UI Elements: Edit, Desktop, SysListView32, SHELLDLL_DefView, Program Manager, Progman Step 5: User left double click on "This is a test.txt (list item)" in "Program Manager" Program: Windows Explorer, 10.0.19041.2845 (WinBuild.160101.0800), Microsoft Corporation, EXPLORER.EXE, EXPLORER.EXE UI Elements: This is a test.txt, Desktop, SysListView32, SHELLDLL_DefView, Program Manager, Progman Step 6: User keyboard input on "Text Editor (edit)" in "This is a test.txt - Notepad" [...] Program: Notepad, 10.0.19041.2845 (WinBuild.160101.0800), Microsoft Corporation, NOTEPAD.EXE C:\USERS\USER\ONEDRIVE - K3 BUSINESS TECHNOLOGY GROUP\DESKTOP\THIS IS A TEST.TXT, NOTEPAD.EXE UI Elements: Text Editor, Edit, This is a test.txt - Notepad, Notepad Step 7: User left click on "Close (button)" in "*This is a test.txt - Notepad" Program: Notepad, 10.0.19041.2845 (WinBuild.160101.0800), Microsoft Corporation, NOTEPAD.EXE C:\USERS\USER\ONEDRIVE - K3 BUSINESS TECHNOLOGY GROUP\DESKTOP\THIS IS A TEST.TXT, NOTEPAD.EXE UI Elements: Close, *This is a test.txt - Notepad, Notepad Step 8: User left click on "Save (button)" in "Notepad" Program: Notepad, 10.0.19041.2845 (WinBuild.160101.0800), Microsoft Corporation, NOTEPAD.EXE C:\USERS\USER\ONEDRIVE - K3 BUSINESS TECHNOLOGY GROUP\DESKTOP\THIS IS A TEST.TXT, NOTEPAD.EXE UI Elements: Save, CCPushButton, Notepad, TaskDialog, Notepad, #32770, *This is a test.txt - Notepad, Notepad Return to top of page...
description:
Program Steps Recorder (PSR)

04 May 2023

10:05

 

Program Steps Recorder (PSR) is a built in tool to most versions of Windows and can be used to record the steps and button presses so that the steps a user makes can be followed.

 

To launch the program go to start and run and type PSR or press Windows Key and Q and type PSR

 

 

 

To start the recording click start recording

 

 

Once all the relevant steps have been taken, press stop record and it it will display what is has recorded.

 

 

 Etc.

 

You know have the option to either re-record the steps or save 

 

On clicking save, it will prompt where to save the files to, the file will be a .zip which can then either be emailed to a support address or copied via file transfer.

 

The contents of the zip is a *.mht file is based on a webpage 

A file with the . MHT file extension is an MHTML Web Archive file that can hold HTML files, images, animation, audio, and other media content. Unlike HTML files, these aren't restricted to holding just text content

 

 

 

An Example of a file.

 

Recorded Steps

 

This file contains all the steps and information that was recorded to help you describe the recorded steps to others. 

Before sharing this file, you should verify the following: 

  • The steps below accurately describe the recording. 
  • There is no information below or on any screenshots that you do not want others to see. 

Passwords or any other text you typed were not recorded, except for function and shortcut keys that you used. 

You can do the following: 

  • Review the recorded steps 
  • Review the recorded steps as a slide show 
  • Review the additional details 

 

Steps

 

Next 

Step 1: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:41) User right click on "Desktop (list)" in "Program Manager"

Step 1 screenshot.

 

Previous Next 

Step 2: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:42) User left click on "New (menu item)"

Step 2 screenshot.

 

Previous Next 

Step 3: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:44) User left click on "Text Document (menu item)"

Step 3 screenshot.

 

Previous Next 

Step 4: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:46) User keyboard input on "Desktop (list)" in "Program Manager" [... ENTER]

Step 4 screenshot.

 

Previous Next 

Step 5: (‎04/‎05/‎2023 10:38:49) User left double click on "This is a test.txt (list item)" in "Program Manager"

Step 5 screenshot.

 

Previous Next

These details help accurately identify the programs and UI you used in this recording.

Please review these details to ensure that they do not contain any information that you would not like others to see.

title: Use CCleaner to tidy up a sluggish PC
text: Cleaning up a slow PC is a payable service. If the customer has an old PC, he should be advised that the best solution is a new PC. Open your browser and go to https://www.ccleaner.com/ Select free download and download the program Open the download folder (Chrome as an example) Click on the exe file to open the installation file Install the program. If this window turns up, click decline Once the program is installed, you will see the below window. Untick View Release Notes and click Run CCleaner (or just close the Release Notes if you forget). Click Start CCleaner Run your first scan. If any programs are running in the background, allow CCleaner to close them. CCleaner will show you the first window of what can be cleaned. Click Clean. CCleaner shows you what it has cleaned so far. Click Next This is the second window of what can be cleaned. Click Clean You get another overview of what has been cleaned. Click Next. This window will show you other things that can be fixed on the PC, but this is only available in the paid version. Click Skip for now If this window pops up, click No thanks. Click Done. Open Tools / Registry and click Scan for Issues Click "Review selected issues" and No to make a backup of the registry. Click Fix all selected issues Once it's done, click Close Remember to uninstall CCleaner afterwards, because it does take a lot of memory to run. If the customer wants to keep it, you can leave it installed, but remind them that we do not support CCleaner if there are any issues with it.
description:
Cleaning up a slow PC is a payable service. If the customer has an old PC, he should be advised that the best solution is a new PC.

Open your browser and go to https://www.ccleaner.com/   


Select free download and download the program



Open the download folder (Chrome as an example)



Click on the exe file to open the installation file



Install the program.



If this window turns up, click decline



Once the program is installed, you will see the below window.


Untick View Release Notes and click Run CCleaner (or just close the Release Notes if you forget).



Click Start CCleaner



Run your first scan.




If any programs are running in the background, allow CCleaner to close them.



CCleaner will show you the first window of what can be cleaned. 


Click Clean.



CCleaner shows you what it has cleaned so far.


Click Next



This is the second window of what can be cleaned.


Click Clean



You get another overview of what has been cleaned.


Click Next.



This window will show you other things that can be fixed on the PC, but this is only available in the paid version.


Click Skip for now



If this window pops up, click No thanks.



Click Done.



Open Tools / Registry and click Scan for Issues



Click "Review selected issues" and No to make a backup of the registry.



Click Fix all selected issues




Once it's done, click Close




Remember to uninstall CCleaner afterwards, because it does take a lot of memory to run. If the customer wants to keep it, you can leave it installed, but remind them that we do not support CCleaner if there are any issues with it.

title: Retention requirements in Germany for accounting data and supporting documents
text: In Germany, there are specific document and transaction retention requirements for traders. According to applicable tax and commercial law, companies must keep their business records, including financial statements, annual accounts, commercial letters and other relevant documents. The documents must be kept for the following periods: 10 years: Financial statements, annual accounts, inventories of assets, progress reports, opening balances, accounting documents and invoices. 6 years: All other business documents In addition, there is a requirement for digital storage of supporting documents and accounting material, which must be kept for at least 5 years. This includes electronic bank reconciliation, receiving and sending e-invoices, and description of bookkeeping procedures In Germany, the retention obligations also apply to providers of software systems that handle customer transactions. According to the German Bookkeeping Act, companies are obliged to ensure that all transactions are properly recorded and stored. This also includes third-party vendors who provide software solutions for accounting and document management. Suppliers must therefore ensure that their systems meet the requirements for digital storage and security, including storing of documents for at least 5 years. It is important that vendors work with their customers to ensure that all legal requirements are met.
description:
In Germany, there are specific document and transaction retention requirements for traders.


According to applicable tax and commercial law, companies must keep their business records,

including financial statements, annual accounts, commercial letters and other relevant documents.


The documents must be kept for the following periods:


10 years: Financial statements, annual accounts, inventories of assets,

progress reports, opening balances, accounting documents and invoices.


6 years: All other business documents


In addition, there is a requirement for digital storage of supporting documents and accounting material, which must be kept for at least 5 years.


This includes electronic bank reconciliation, receiving and sending e-invoices, and description of bookkeeping procedures


In Germany, the retention obligations also apply to providers of software systems that handle customer transactions.


According to the German Bookkeeping Act, companies are obliged to ensure that all transactions are properly recorded and stored.

This also includes third-party vendors who provide software solutions for accounting and document management.


Suppliers must therefore ensure that their systems meet the requirements for digital storage and security, including storing

of documents for at least 5 years. It is important that vendors work with their customers to ensure that all legal requirements are met.
